details:
It was discovered that there was an arbitrary object deserialization
vulnerability in php-horde-turba, an address book component for the Horde
groupware suite.


* [CVE-2022-30287](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2022-30287)
Horde Groupware Webmail Edition through 5.2.22 allows a reflection
 injection attack through which an attacker can instantiate a driver class.
 This then leads to arbitrary deserialization of PHP objects.


For Debian 10 Buster, these problems have been fixed in version
4.2.23-1+deb10u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your php-horde-turba packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
